Zend_Uri  
Yes 
No 

Description

Abstract class for all Zend_Uri handlers

Methods

__construct, __toString, check, factory, getScheme, getUri, setConfig, valid,

__construct( string   $scheme, string   $schemeSpecific, ) : n/a

Description

Zend_Uri and its subclasses cannot be instantiated directly.

Use Zend_Uri::factory() to return a new Zend_Uri object.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$scheme string | The scheme of the URI
$schemeSpecific string | The scheme-specific part of the URI

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

__toString( ) : string

Description

Return a string representation of this URI.

Return value

Type Description
string

Tags

Name Description
see getUri()

check( string   $uri, ) : boolean

Description

Convenience function, checks that a $uri string is well-formed by validating it but not returning an object. Returns TRUE if $uri is a well-formed URI, or FALSE otherwise.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$uri string | The URI to check

Return value

Type Description
boolean

factory( string   $uri = http, string   $className = null, ) : Zend_Uri

Description

Create a new Zend_Uri object for a URI. If building a new URI, then $uri should contain only the scheme (http, ftp, etc). Otherwise, supply $uri with the complete URI.

Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$uri string | The URI form which a Zend_Uri instance is created http
$className string | The name of the class to use in order to manipulate URI null

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Uri

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When an empty string was supplied for the scheme
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When an illegal scheme is supplied
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When the scheme is not supported
throws Zend_Uri_Exception When $className doesn&#039;t exist or doesn&#039;t implements Zend_Uri
link http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2396.html

getScheme( ) : string|false

Description

Get the URI's scheme

Return value

Type Description
string|false Scheme or false if no scheme is set.
